issues.title: Missing Requirement for Annual Board Resolution Certifying Course-Based Independent Study Programs
issues.description: Education Code 51749.5(c) requires that courses in course-based independent study programs be "annually certified by resolution of the governing board" to meet specific quality and equivalency standards. While BP 6158 mentions this requirement in the Course-Based Independent Study section, there is no corresponding implementation procedure in AR 6158 detailing how this annual certification process will be carried out.

legal_citations.text: Courses shall be annually certified by resolution of the governing board of the school district to be of the same rigor and educational quality and to provide intellectual challenge that is substantially equivalent to in-person, classroom-based instruction, and shall be aligned to all relevant local and state content standards.

issues.required_language: The Superintendent or designee shall annually prepare and present to the Board for adoption a resolution certifying that all course-based independent study courses meet the requirements of Education Code 51749.5(c), including documentation of course rigor, educational quality, intellectual challenge substantially equivalent to in-person instruction, alignment to content standards, duration, instructional minutes, course credits, and synchronous instruction plans by grade span.

issues.title: Missing Procedures for Student-Parent-Educator Conference Before Signing Written Agreement
issues.description: Education Code 51747(c)(1) requires districts to conduct a student-parent-educator conference upon parent/guardian request before signing the written agreement. While BP 6158 mentions this requirement, AR 6158 lacks implementation procedures for scheduling, conducting, and documenting these conferences.

legal_citations.text: Upon the request of the parent or guardian of a pupil, and before signing a written agreement as described in subdivision (g), the school district shall conduct a telephone, videoconference, or in-person pupil-parent-educator conference or other meeting during which the pupil, parent or guardian, and, if requested by the parent or guardian, an advocate may ask questions about the educational options available to the pupil.

issues.required_language: Upon request by a parent/guardian, the Superintendent or designee shall schedule and conduct a student-parent-educator conference before the written agreement is signed. The conference may be conducted by telephone, videoconference, or in-person and shall include the student, parent/guardian, supervising teacher, and if requested by the parent/guardian, an advocate. The conference shall provide opportunity to discuss educational options, curriculum offerings, and nonacademic supports available in independent study. Documentation of the conference shall be maintained in the student's file.

issues.title: Missing Specific Procedures for Tiered Reengagement Strategies Implementation
issues.description: While BP 6158 lists the required components of tiered reengagement strategies per Education Code 51747(d), AR 6158 lacks detailed implementation procedures for executing these strategies, including timelines, responsible staff, documentation requirements, and escalation procedures.

legal_citations.text: Procedures for tiered reengagement strategies shall be used for all pupils participating in an independent study program for 15 schooldays or more who are not generating attendance for more than three schooldays or 60 percent of the instructional days in a school week...

issues.required_language: The Superintendent or designee shall implement tiered reengagement procedures that include: (1) verification of current contact information within 24 hours of enrollment; (2) notification to parents/guardians within one school day of recording nonattendance or lack of participation; (3) outreach plan including health and social services connections as needed; (4) student-parent-educator conference requirements when reengagement triggers are met. Staff responsibilities, documentation requirements, and timelines for each tier shall be clearly defined and implemented consistently across all independent study programs.

issues.title: Missing Specific Procedures for Transition Back to In-Person Instruction
issues.description: While BP 6158 requires a plan to transition students back to in-person instruction within five instructional days, AR 6158 lacks specific implementation procedures for this transition process, including notification requirements, enrollment procedures, and coordination between programs.

legal_citations.text: For pupils who participate in an independent study program for 15 schooldays or more, develop a plan to transition pupils whose families wish to return to in-person instruction from independent study expeditiously, and, in no case, later than five instructional days.

issues.required_language: Upon request from families to return to in-person instruction, the Superintendent or designee shall implement transition procedures including: (1) processing the request within one school day; (2) coordinating with receiving schools for enrollment; (3) transferring academic records and progress documentation; (4) completing the transition within five instructional days. Specific staff responsibilities and documentation requirements for the transition process shall be established.
